009
010package imagingbook.pub.regions;
011
012import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
013import java.util.ArrayList;
014import java.util.Iterator;
015import java.util.List;
016
017import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Point;
018
019/**
020 * This class represents a closed contour as a sequence of
021 * pixel coordinates. It implements the {@link Comparable}
022 * interface for sorting contours by length.
023 * It supports iteration over the points along the contour, 
024 * e.g., by
025 * <pre>
026 * Contour C = ...;
027 * for (Point p : C) {
028 *    // process p ...
029 * }
030 * </pre>
031 * 
032 * @version 2020/04/01
033 */
034public class Contour implements Comparable<Contour>, Iterable<Point> {
035        
036        static private int INITIAL_SIZE = 50;
037        
038        private final int label;
039        private final List<Point> points;
040        
041        /**
042         * Creates a new (empty) contour with the given region label.
043         * @param label the region label for this contour.
044         */
045        public Contour (int label) {
046                this.label = label;
047                points = new ArrayList<Point>(INITIAL_SIZE);
048        }
049        
050        protected void addPoint (Point p) {
051                points.add(p);
052        }
053        
054        //--------------------- retrieve contour points -------
055        
056        /**
057         * Get the list of contour points.
058         * @return a reference to the internal list of contour points.
059         */
060        public List<Point> getPointList() {
061                return points;
062        }
063        
064        /**
065         * Get the contour points as an array.
066         * @return a new array of contour points.
067         */
068        public Point[] getPointArray() {
069                return points.toArray(new Point[0]);
070        }
071                
072        //--------------------- contour statistics ------------
073        
074        /**
075         * Get the length of the contour.
076         * @return the number of points on the contour.
077         */
078        public int getLength() {
079                return points.size();
080        }
081        
082        /**
083         * Get the region label associated with this contour.
084         * @return the region label of the contour.
085         */
086        public int getLabel() {
087                return label;
088        }
089        
090        //--------------------- debug methods ------------------
091        
092//      private void printPoints () {
093//              for (Point pt: points) {
094//                      IJ.log(pt.toString());
095//              }
096//      }
097        
098        @Override
099        public String toString(){
100                return
101                        "Contour " + label + ": " + this.getLength() + " points";
102        }
103        
104        /**
105         * Get the polygon for this contour (for subsequent drawing).
106         * @return the polygon.
107         */
108        public Path2D getPolygonPath() {
109                return getPolygonPath(0.5, 0.5);        // offset by 0.5 to pass through pixel centers
110        }
111        
112        /**
113         * Get the polygon for this contour (for subsequent drawing).
114         * An offset can be specified for shifting the contour positions
115         * at pixel centers (set to 0.5/0.5).
116         * 
117         * @param xOffset the horizontal offset.
118         * @param yOffset the vertical offset.
119         * @return a polygon.
120         */
121        public Path2D getPolygonPath(double xOffset, double yOffset) {
122                Path2D path = new Path2D.Float();
123                Point[] pnts = this.getPointArray();
124                if (pnts.length > 1){
125                        path.moveTo(pnts[0].getX() + xOffset, pnts[0].getY() + yOffset);
126                        for (int i = 1; i < pnts.length; i++) {
127                                path.lineTo(pnts[i].getX() + xOffset,  pnts[i].getY() + yOffset);
128                        }
129                        path.closePath();
130                }
131                else {  // mark single pixel region "X"
132                        double x = pnts[0].getX();
133                        double y = pnts[0].getY();
134                        path.moveTo(x + xOffset - 0.5, y + yOffset - 0.5);
135                        path.lineTo(x + xOffset + 0.5, y + yOffset + 0.5);
136                        path.moveTo(x + xOffset - 0.5, y + yOffset + 0.5);
137                        path.lineTo(x + xOffset + 0.5, y + yOffset - 0.5);
138                }
139                return path;
140        }
141
142                
143        // Compare method for sorting contours by length (longer contours at front)
144        @Override
145        public int compareTo(Contour c2) {
146                return c2.points.size() - this.points.size();
147        }
148
149        @Override
150        public Iterator<Point> iterator() {
151                return points.iterator();
152        }
153
154}
